stem: The patient's fundal height is [BLANK] cm, consistent with a gestational age of 28 weeks.

itemContext.sbar: 07:00, S: Patient is a 28-year-old (G1P0) female at 28 weeks gestation, here for a routine prenatal visit. She reports feeling well, with no contractions, bleeding, or fluid leakage. She's been taking prenatal vitamins daily and reports consistent fetal movement. A: Patient is stable, with vital signs within normal limits. Fundal height palpated. No complaints of pain or discomfort. B: First pregnancy, no significant medical history. Blood type is A positive. Ultrasound at 20 weeks showed normal fetal anatomy. R: Continue routine prenatal care. Assess fundal height and fetal heart tones. Provide education on signs of preterm labor and when to seek medical attention. Schedule next appointment in two weeks.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content: 07:00, S: Patient is a 28-year-old (G1P0) female at 28 weeks gestation, here for a routine prenatal visit. She reports feeling well, with no contractions, bleeding, or fluid leakage. She's been taking prenatal vitamins daily and reports consistent fetal movement. A: Patient is stable, with vital signs within normal limits. Fundal height palpated. No complaints of pain or discomfort. B: First pregnancy, no significant medical history. Blood type is A positive. Ultrasound at 20 weeks showed normal fetal anatomy. R: Continue routine prenatal care. Assess fundal height and fetal heart tones. Provide education on signs of preterm labor and when to seek medical attention. Schedule next appointment in two weeks.

tabs.title: Vitals
tabs.content: BP: 120/80 mmHg, HR: 80 bpm, RR: 16 breaths/min, Temp: 98.6°F (37°C)

tabs.title: Labs
tabs.content: Hemoglobin: 12.5 g/dL, Hematocrit: 37%, Glucose: 85 mg/dL, Urine protein: Negative

tabs.title: Physical Exam
tabs.content: General: Alert and oriented x3, well-appearing. HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic. Cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm. Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally. Abdomen: Fundal height 28 cm, Fetal heart tones present.

tabs.title: Radiology
tabs.content: Ultrasound at 20 weeks showed normal fetal anatomy.

rationale.correct: At 28 weeks gestation, the fundal height in centimeters typically correlates with the gestational age in weeks (plus or minus 2 cm). Therefore, a fundal height of 28 cm is expected. This correlation is due to the consistent growth of the uterus as the fetus develops. Measuring fundal height is a simple, non-invasive way to monitor fetal growth during prenatal visits. Deviations from this expected range can indicate potential issues such as intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) or macrosomia.
rationale.incorrect: Fundal height should correlate with gestational age, +/- 2cm. Values significantly above or below this range warrant further investigation for possible complications such as multiple gestation, polyhydramnios, IUGR or measurement errors. It's important to consider other factors that can influence fundal height, such as maternal body habitus, amniotic fluid volume, and fetal position. Relying solely on fundal height without considering these factors can lead to misinterpretation of fetal growth.
clinicalPearls: Fundal height measurement is a key part of prenatal care to assess fetal growth and development.
Significant discrepancies between fundal height and gestational age should be investigated further.
Factors like maternal body habitus, amniotic fluid volume, and fetal position can influence fundal height measurements.
Fundal height is measured from the top of the symphysis pubis to the top of the fundus.

questionTrap.description: Students might select an incorrect answer if they don't understand the correlation between fundal height and gestational age or if they confuse units of measurement. They may also fail to consider the normal range of variation (+/- 2 cm).
questionTrap.strategy: Emphasize the importance of accurate fundal height measurement and its correlation with gestational age. Provide opportunities to practice interpreting fundal height measurements in different scenarios. Reinforce the concept of a normal range of variation and the factors that can influence fundal height.

mnemonic.title: Fundal Height Rule of Thumb
mnemonic.description: Generally, after 20 weeks, fundal height in centimeters roughly equals gestational age in weeks. Think: 'Weeks equals Where (fundus is)'
